lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: If we be not relieved within this hour, We must return to the court of guard: the night Is shiny and they say we shall embattle By the second hour i the morn.

lines.speaker: second soldier
lines.text: This last day was A shrewd one tos.

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: Be witness to me, O thou blessed moon, When men revolted shall upon record Bear hateful memory, poor Enobarbus did Before thy face repent!

lines.speaker: domitius enobarbus
lines.text: O sovereign mistress of true melancholy, The poisonous damp of night disponge upon me, That life, a very rebel to my will, May hang no longer on me: throw my heart Against the flint and hardness of my fault: Which, being dried with grief, will break to powder, And finish all foul thoughts. O Antony, Nobler than my revolt is infamous, Forgive me in thine own particular But let the world rank me in register A masterleaver and a fugitive: O Antony! O Antony!

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Lets hear him, for the things he speaks May concern Caesar.

lines.speaker: third soldier
lines.text: Lets do so. But he sleeps.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: Swoons rather for so bad a prayer as his Was never yet for sleep.

lines.speaker: third soldier
lines.text: Awake, sir, awake speak to us.

lines.speaker: first soldier
lines.text: The hand of death hath raught him. Hark! the drums Demurely wake the sleepers. Let us bear him To the court of guard he is of note: our hour Is fully out.

lines.speaker: third soldier
lines.text: Come on, then He may recover yet.
